content:
Great puzzle ! The statement is very concise :)
I personally like it that way, some might like to have a back story.

I lost some hairs trying to solve it.
I would approve it if I could get past the final tests.
I'll try later on if it is not approved by someone else then.

Keep up the good ideas Nagrarok !

First 28 cases gets passed when using mutation with random swaps. Someone else plz test the rest of the test cases. Seems like a bit hard problem. Could also make a good problem for novice users if the score is the difference is the absolute difference to the answer. I approve! Timelimit is 5 seconds. Should be specified in the problem.
Why does generator generate two integers ? Most languages do not support such big ints.
I consider it's the programmer's job to realize he/she needs to use strings to solve the problem. Using strings in the stub generator would be giving away a clue, in my opinion.

First, this puzzle remind me of https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/738e5f7f3d5798086768c53e5a05bb55ca4 . In both puzzles, I see people prying for a heuristic approach to solve the puzzle while there exists an algorithmic solution that is both faster and more relevant.
Seriously, a good think for novice is to learn algorithmic first, and  then algorithmic for IA.

Second, the limit time is not 5s but depend on the language in use.

Finally, you ask for people to do the review job while you vote and get the XP. This is unacceptable!

reverted back my approve vote as I have not tested the "very large cases". I didn't really approve for the XP. The problem is challenging and has quality test cases (which breaks my randomized mutation).
My code gives the expected answer for every test/validator.

I'm not sure this is the most important part of this puzzle and, IMHO, either one does not know how to solve this puzzle (and then no matter what the generator do) either one can try to solve it and then the fact that generator is "incorrect" is just a waste of time.
It is NOT the programmer's job to verify that what appears in the input box is actually what the program receives. That is the one thing that must be provided in the stub.

Well, the program does receive integers, and the generator doesn't know about the maximum int size in the language that the programmer is using.
If more people think it should use strings, I will change it.
I would prefer a stub with word(1024) instead of int, but it is not really important imho.
Iâ€¦haven't solved this yet, but I had to report the stub is non-functional in C++.

Someone replaced the stub with something invalid...
Thanks for reporting, I fixed it.

The current stub does not work for Python / Python3, because the default code generated expects 2 input strings instead of splitting 1 input string into 2 strings.

Is it ok to change the stub and the inputs for all tests/validators so that inputs are given in 2 lines instead?
Yes my bad, I forgot that it was only one line when I fixed the stub. Now it should work.
